topic.title: Using Web Author with a SharePoint Online Repository

body.p: includes a SharePoint plugin that allows you to edit files stored in a SharePoint Online repository. To access the files in your SharePoint Online repository, it is assumed that this plugin is enabled in your installation of .

section.title: Opening or Creating Files
section.p: To open a file stored in a SharePoint Online repository, go to the main Dashboard, click the SharePoint tab, and click the Open icon. You may need to log in, then once you have found the file you want to open, double-click it (or tap on a mobile device). The first time this dialog box is opened, you will be presented with the available root sites that can be accessed.The SharePoint plugin can only browse resources from SharePoint Online (URLs such as: https://domain.sharepoint.com/) or One Drive (URLs like https://domain-my.sharepoint.com/).
To create a new file, go to the main Dashboard, click the SharePoint tab, and click the New icon. A Choose Template dialog box will be displayed. Select a document template and click OK.
section.note: If your connection has not yet been configured, a dialog box will be displayed that provides instructions for configuring and selecting the URL for the connection. For more information, see .

section.title: Checking in and Checking out SharePoint Resources
section.p: SharePoint integrations include some toolbar buttons that allow you to easily check resources in or out. These SharePoint-specific actions are as follows:

dlentry.dd: Use this action to check out the currently edited document. After a successful check-out, the file name will be decorated with a distinctive mark () to indicate that the file is currently checked out and this Check Out button becomes unavailable.

dd.p: Use this action to check in the currently edited document. The file can only be checked in if it was previously checked out by the current user. If there are unsaved changes, you will be prompted to save the file. Selecting this action will open a dialog box that contains the check in version and allows you to enter a comment. After a successful check-in, the check-out decorator mark is removed from the file name and this Check In button becomes unavailable.

Use this action to discard the check-out on the currently edited document. The check-out can only be discarded if the file was previously checked out by the current user. When selecting this action, you will be prompted for confirmation. After a successful discard, the check-out decorator mark is removed from the file name and this Discard Check Out button becomes unavailable.All the changes made to the document since the last time the file was checked out will also be discarded and the document will be reloaded.
